text: 330 ml. bb 23/11/19. Coal black pour with a big spongy foam. Nose is semi-sweet chocolate, orange, espresso graham flour and dark toasted marshmallow. Flavors of molasses, espresso, char thats almost smoke, soured orange, soy and marshmallow. Medium body has low-medium carbonation. A little sticky, but still very tasty and drinkable.

Ocena przepisana z notatek / innego serwisu, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na RateBeer. Nuty utlenienia, śliwka w czekoladzie z likierem, paloność. W smaku nieco wodnisty, dość wysoko nasycony, delikatnie metaliczny. Spodziewałem się więcej, ale mimo drobnych wad, jest naprawdę w porządku.

Keg at the Star and Garter, Bromley. Black pour with a tan head. Dark roast coffee, licorice, burnt toffee, treacle and dark chocolate aroma. Lots of dark roast coffee in the flavour plus woodsmoke, dark chocolate, licorice toffee and cocoa too. Light bitterness in the mouthfeel. Smoky dry finish. Very good.

Intense chocolate, caramel, cacao, molasses, dark chocolate, pralines Black, medium, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More chocolate, sweet molasses, caramel, toffee, sweet, dark, toasted malts, soft carbonation, full bodied. Very nice Porter, well-balanced. Keg at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.

Bottle. Pitch black colour, large (even too large), creamy, brown head. Aroma of bitter chocolate, coffee beans, cocoa, citrus. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium+ bitter, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, fruits. Medium body and carbonation, long bitter finish. Good and quite bitter porter.

Közepes, tartós hab, fekete szín. Isteni, csokis, kakaós, aszaltgyümölcsös illat. Csokis, kakaóporos, kávés ízvilág, aszalt és sötétgyümölcsös aromákkal. Száraz, testes, közepesen szénsavas, erősen keserű. Nagyon finom, jó egyensúlyú és arányú porter.

Bottle, 8% ABV. Pours a dark brown with a very large, billowy yet thick, dark-latte colored head. Aroma is liquorice, roast, some citrus roast. Taste is liquorice, roast, coffee, some chocolate, citrusy and earthy. Very good. Smooth, fairly full.

Szójaszerű főzet, ragyogó kinézetű porter; olajos, sűrű, feketébe hajlóan barna színű sör a Mikkellertől. Krémessége már az illatában is megmutatkozik, enyhe marcipános, mandulás beütésű, de leginkább mégis pörkölt színezettel bíró, lágy aromafelhőcskék szabadulnak fel rögtön, biztató előjelei tehát egy kimagasló értékű ízvilág irányába mutatnak. Selymes, tejszínes szerkezet ad otthont az egyszerű porterek alighanem egyik legkiválóbb példányának ízjegyei számára; ízletes, karakteres, teljes értékű ital benyomását nyújtja az egyébként nem kimondottan a legnagyobb kedvencemként számon tartott típus szimpatikus mintapéldánya. Kellően pörkölt, jólesően édes, gusztusosan csokoládés, intenzíven kávés, s összességében gömbölyded, könnyen csúszó, tartalmas elemek megnyerő elegyét adja a nem éppenn a felejthető kategóriába tartozó dán porter.
Bardzo obfita piana. Czekolada, kawa, paloność, ciemne owoce. Dochodzi słodycz, coś w stylu marcepanu. Ocena na podstawie notatek pisanych przed założeniem konta na RB.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Świetny, klasyczny porter. Intensywne nuty palone, czekoladowe, ciemne owoce i melasa. Fajne, kremowe ciało. Dość wysoka goryczka.
Bottle. Jet black, nice beige head. Aroma roasty, choclate. Taste rather dry, roasted, dark choclate. Average body.

(bottle)
Aroma:roasted malt,some esters,hint of black pepper.
Appearance:black color,mediums-sized frothy brown head.
Taste:semi-sweet,bit sour,flavour of roasted malt,coffee,dark bitter chocolate,uber dry slighlty boozy finish.
Palate:medium body,low carbonation.
Overall:Ok-ish uber roasty brew but it tastes more like a stout.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Bottle at hops beer bar. Pitch black colour small brown foam. Nose is roasted malts, with definive chocholate. Taste is low bitterness that turns later into medium bitterness. Roastedness all over. Cocoa, coffee malts. Smooth mouthfeel. Nice porter!

Aromat rozpoczyna feria ciemnych, palonych słodów: kakao, gorzka czekolada, kawa, trochę słodyczy wiśni likierowych, ale i utlenienie w stronę sosu sojowego. Z czasem słodszy aromat kojarzący się z kruchymi ciastkami czekoladowymi z bakaliami. W smaku świetny balans, średnia ale podbita ciemnymi słodami goryczka. Na początku słodko. Dominuje kawa, czekolada, śliwki, wiśnie w likierze z wytrawnym, lekko wysuszającym finiszem. Gładkie, aksamitne, kompleksowe. Świetne, degustacyjne piwo.

0,33L bottle.Pours pitch black with big brown head.Full aroma of coffee,chocolate.Taste of coffee,roasty,vanilla.Full body.Medium carbonation.roasty and slightly bitter aftertaste.Really liked this Porter.

Negro intenso con buena cabeza de espuma marrón, que parece la crema de un café capuchino; aromas a chocolate negro, malta torrefacta, café y algo de cacao; en boca entrada potente muy maltosa y cremosa con amargor muy equilibrado, cuerpo pleno y bajo carbónico, siguen notas terrosas, cítricas y torrefactas perfectamente ensambladas, largo retrogusto, maltoso y amargo, excelente cerveza muy disfrutable de principio a fin.

33cl bottle from Alko, Viikki. This pretty ordinary, still a good beer reminds me of saying: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act but a habit. - Aristoteles. Well done Porter!

Bottle. Pours black with medium brown head. Aroma is coffee, caramel, bitter notes, cream, some vanilla, sweetness, light roast. Taste is coffee, roast, some sourness, beans, chocolate, burned white bread, cookies, bitter, carbon, light smoke. Very long and bitter/roasty/coffee aftertaste. Super beer!

330ml bottle. (8% ABV) Pours an opaque black with a huge, frothy, never ending, light brown head that leaves full curtains of lace. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, licorice and light smoke. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice, caramel, brown sugar and a hint of peat with a hoppy, bitter coffee finish. Medium body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Excellent, a world class porter.

Bottle from Bottle Shop, Bjerringbro. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is dark roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Roasted finish. Nice.

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel, smoke, tar, leather and coffee beans. The color is pitch black and the head is fluffy and mocha-like. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, caramel, smoke, tar, rope, leather and ground coffee. A nice beer!
Tasted twice. Very intensive porter, lots of caramel, cocoa, high tobacco biterness, dry finish, low carbonated, awesome head. A cool porter, really.

Beautiful black colour with a think brown layer of foam. Smells of caramel, coffee and chocolate. The beer is thick with a great taste of coffee, malt, burned caramel and peat.

ABV 8% on tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem during Mikkeller tap takeover. 
Nose is cocoa. 
Body is pitch black, head is medium, brownish, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. 
Aroma is cocoa, dark chocolate, roasted malt, dried fruits, old smoked wood, mild rested coffee. 
Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. 
Finish is long lasting roasty medium bitter, later also hoppy. 
Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Bit heavy dessert beer, strong fantastic flavor, well balanced, great one.

From draft at Uitlje Bar Haarlem during the Mikkeller tap-takeover. Pours a dark brown with a small tan head. Beautifully balanced, nice sweet chocolate and dark malts on the nose. more of and old coffee aftertaste with a fitting bitter. Medium bitter, under medium sweet. Medium body with quite some carbonation.
Bottle at home: a perfectly balanced porter with a sweet aroma hints of chocolate and aftertaste of burnt coffee.

Jet black with frothy, medium-thick mocha head. Nose is roasted malts, coffee, licorice, some caramel and licorice notes. Taste is delicately bitter with hints of coffee, dried prunes and cocoa. Low to average carbonation, creamy texture, medium body. Very good.
Bottle from my ex-colleagues. Pours black with thick brown head. Aroma is roasty with licorice, milk and a bit of pine. Taste is bitter with coffee, hops, licorice, chocolate.

BOTTLE 33 CL at 8% ABV. Pitch black, big espresso head. Rich dark fruit, prunes, dark chocolate, traces of hops and maybe something smoky. Just the right amount of sweetness, augmented by the perfect balance of bitterness - roasty and hoppy. Rich, smooth and easy drinking. Excellent!

Pours black with thick, very persistent brown foam. It looks like a milkshake in the glass. Very strong toasted malt, rich cocoa notes. Medium / heavy body, slick texture with dry, fruity finish. Light fizz. Molasses and anise tastes, very rich porter. The high ABV is fairly muted, but catches up. Strong flavors all around and stands up to strong food.

Bottle from web Mikkeller cons 2016-12-23 Göteborg 
AR: dark sweet chocolate, milk and coffee
AP: darkest brown, dark brown thick high frothy head
F: far rich fruity chocolate, heavy African coffey, salt liqurice, tar, lactose sweetness
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Weihnachtskalender von Mikkeller). Tiefes Schwarz mit kompaktem beigem Schaum. Edle schwarze Schokolade schmeckt vor. Im Nachtrunk Chilinoten.

Bottle. Black with big frothy brown head. Malty. Aroma of roasty, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, coffee and fruity hops. Complex. Starts medium sweet and finish medium with fairly long duration with roasty notes. Good balance. The body is medium and the texture is oily. Good carbonation. A nice one...

Black. Soy, caramel, chocolate, liquorice, and a heavy load of roasted barley. Moderately sweet taste with a dry and strong malty bitter finish. Full body and a very soft texture. Overall, a good porter. Tasty and drinkable. The bitter finish really stands out.
(8% abv version)

12oz bottle from Hops and Grapes in Hickory, NC: blackish pour, huge sturdy long lasting tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, soy. Tastes of chocolate, roasted malt, light burnt vibe, coffee, pine, citrus, dried fruit, faint tobacco, mineral, spice. Fairly substantial pine bitter. Balances all of that out somehow - impressively so. Occasional sipper for me. A small bottle was perfect share between me and the missus.

Backlog, Bottle, dark black with a really tan looking head. Smell and flavor are chocolate, coffee, wood, roasted malt, light vanilla extract, and licorice. Some nutty and complex notes as it warms up. Medium body.

Bottle. Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has caramel, licorice, dark fruits and dark malt. Taste is malty sweet with long quite bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, dark fruits, dark bread, coffee, dark chocolate. Very well balanced.

Oily brownish black beer with humongous head which leaves the most perfect lacing as it gently concedes. Aroma has roasted malts, coffee notes, dark chocolate. Taste has roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel sweetness and quite dry after taste with some hop flavours. Medium oily body with low carbonation. Good but not great.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, coffee and hops. Flavour is roasted, medium bitter and coffee. Full bodied and quite smooth.

Bottle. Pitch black with a thick lasting fluffy brown head. Aroma is of biscuits, caramel, liquorice, dark fruits, toffee, treacle, dark chocolate, coffee. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, bitter hints, treacle, maple syrup, biscuits, liquorice. Syrupy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Pours black with nice brown head. Aroma of strong coffee combined with pine, roasty malts and little licorice. Flavour has roasty malts along with pine and coffee which ends with hops. Soft mouthfeel, bitter finish. Great porter
Bottle. Pours oily and viscous with medium tanned head. Aroma is liquorice, coffee, smoke, earthy and a bit ashy. Taste is sweet, roasty, burnt popcorn, liquorice, hops.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The aroma could have been stronger and the palate thicker. The taste however is nothing but perfect. Even though they are not distinct anymore, those hops still work their magic. The added sugar makes sure it is a porter instead of a stout.

Bottle from Alko, only rated at 8% ABV. Pours black with strong chocolate head. Licorice, coffee, some alcohol. Chocolate, roast malt, licorice, coffee. Quite bitter, with sticky and oily palate. A great porter and deceptively easy to drink for the ABV.
How: bottle Appearance: almost black with a large tannned head. pretty. Aroma_: burnt caramel, chocholate, coffee, cherries, black berries. Palate: medium to full body, smooth carbonation.

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki (as 8%). Pours jet black with a magnificient big, brown head. The aroma features abundant heavily roasty maltiness with rye bread, strong coffee and licorice featuring; also a solid presence of pine. Taste is heavily roasty and dryish; also quite hoppy. Medium to heavily bitter in the finish. Flavours of licorice and coffee from the malty side, a touch of spruce and pine from the hops. The palate is medium to full bodied, fairly smooth and low to average in carbonation. A great porter; intense flavours with lots of variety but still a good drinkability. Does not differ much from hoppy imperial stouts.

Aroma is soft roasted notes with a bit of hops. black beer with nice brown head. taste is light bitterness and light sweetness. palate is medium body, creamy, soft carbonation. One of the best porters that hasnt been tweaked with weird ingredients.
330ml bottle. Creamy texture. Chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Nicely balanced. Really good porter!
Olipa hyvä. Ihan parhaita portereita. Hyvä koostumus ja maku. Myös ulkonäkö kohdillaan.
Tap at Crafthouse Prague. Deep dark colour with stable huge head off. Aroma off coffee, chocolate,nuts. Taste of nuts,roasted coffee, bitter finish. Owww
Bottle. Pours oil-like black with foamy brown head. Aroma has chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, and hops. Taste has coffee, roasted malt, bitter dark chocolate and brown sugar. Great porter!
Bottle from Alko 8 brewed in Belgium. Thick black with thick xxl beige head. Roasted, coffee, some syrupy. Round strong bitterness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

33 cl, bottled. Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma: Roasted malt, pine, coffee and notes of chocolate. Taste: Medium sweet. Coffee, chocolate notes. Burnt notes. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Creamy texture. Nice porter.

Tap - Good persistent brown Head, strong heavy bitter taste, not my kinda style

On tap. Black with one finger dark brown head. Coffee, vanilla, chocolate aroma. Taste is similar, nice and creamy. Very nice porter.

Black body, thick creamy, tan head. malty aroma, very roasty, coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is roasty malts, coffee, some sweetness. rich, oily body, thick mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Very nice, solid porter.
Bottle from BoxBeer. very dark brown with athick brown head. Malty and roasted tones. Malt, fruit, coffee and bitterness. Medium to full body with a long bitter / roasted finish.

Pours dark black with a brown lively head and good lacing.

Aroma is plum, coffee, blackberry, hint of apricot. Taste has initial sweetness and then a long, bitter, salty finish with nice booze at the end.

Good porter, just a little short of great.

Caramel, coffee, chocolate, licorice scent. The same applies to the taste of sweetness, too. Lovely bitterness that fills the mouth forever. A very good and enjoyable beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

0.33 bottle.   A seemingly clear, black color with a huge, brown, creamy head of great retention but leaving only basic lacing. A deep aroma of dark malts, wood, dried fruits, delicate hints of resin, and some prunes. Taste of smoke, toasted malts, wood, nuts - primarily sweet but with notable, bitter notes. A full body, a creamy texture, and a flat carbonation. Finish is longish, bitterer, a tad hoppier but that may only be an impression. Overall the beer is splendid and characterized by a very pleasant viscosity; one does not earn a place in top 50 porters casually it would seem.

Deep oily black, huge dense creamy dark brown head, god lacing. Chocolate, coffee, licorice, soya, bit smoke, roasted malt, medicinal herbs. Dry, bitter, roasted, medium body, soft, long finish. Great, nice pure flavors, good balance, enjoyed.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours pitch black with a small tan head and an aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, licorice, candy sugar and plums. The taste is sweet with a long bitter finish. Outstanding porter.

Pours a black colour with a big very brwon head. Medium retention, creamy brown lace. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, dried fruits, roasted malts. MEdium body, creamy palate, ok carbonation. Taste of coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, brown sugar. Very good.

Sort Porter med ikke-eksisterende skumkrone, men kun med mørk moccafarvet kant og overflade. Ufiltreret "sort olie". 
Aroma af lakrids, hårdt ristede malte, melasse, tjære og røgmalt. 
Fantastisk rig smag af solid bitterhed og en smule røg, altsammen på et højt niveau. Afbalanceret med en forsvinde lille, men vigtig sødme. Noter af kaffe, lidt mindre lakrids og ristede malte i rigmål. 
Ganske fyldig krop og en let, men tydelig nedjusteret karbonering. Konsistensen er olieret og afslutningen bitter, næsten besk, tør og kort. 
Overall: Igen en øl fra Mikkeller, der viser, hvilken kvalitet han vil have. Denne er ikke avanceret ift. mange smagsindtryk, men solidt lavet og meget true-to-style.

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, medium brown micro head.
Nose is roasted, somewhat sweet. Very nice and rounded taste, malty with hints of coffee and roasted malts. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

Big and creamy brown head very long lasting.
Opaque very dark mahogany colour. Black appearance.
Aroma is ripe dark fruit (prune, raisin), fruity, chocolate, roasted caramel and vanilla.
Taste is roasted dry dark fruit, roasted malts and burnt sugar, showing some acidity and burnt cookies flavour.
Very creamy palate, very thick body with slight diacetyl presence.
Burnt and very tasteful porter.

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted mat, coffee, mocha, chocolate, notes of citrus, touch of liquorice, dark fruits and hops. Flavour is moderate sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium to full. Wow, smooth and exquisite Porter, damn tasty.

Uit de fles geschonken, zwart bier met bruine schuimkraag. Aromas van gebrande mout, chocola en hop. Smaken van gebrande mout, hop, chocola en rood fruit. Een hele lekkere porter met een mooie volle bittere smaak.

Black colour with a sticky tan head. Coffee, chocolate, cookies, malts. Good! I prefer this normal version more.

Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are large chocolate and roasted malts. Great porter
Bottle 0.33l at home, Riihimäki. BBE 23/11/19. Colour is almost black wit large brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Very nice roastiness.

Bittere en zware porter, met duidelijke tonen van gebrande koffie, mokka en chocolade. Hierdoor is het een stevig bier. Kleur is zwart, schuim is beige door de gebrande mout. Ook een zoete laag (kandijsuiker).

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, beige firm creamy head. Citrus hoppy nose along roasted malty chocolate, coffee, light red fruits: bitter sweet finish, fruity too, a little dry, keeps nicely lingering. Good body, great balance, soft mouthfeel, low carbonation.
Bottle.Pitch black colour with large beige head.Aroma of licorice and chocolate with good creamy mouthfeels and smooth and mild notes of hops and soya.

Obfita, gęsta, brązowa piana, trwała, ładnie zdobiąca ścianki szkła. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat zdominowany przez wyraźną czekoladę, kakao, praliny i kawę espresso. W smaku troszkę słodyczy, bardzo niewiele kwaśności od ciemnych słodów, piwo w odbiorze jest likierowe, treściwe, czekoladowo kawowe. Posmaki długie, pojawia się troszkę popiołowości, troszkę żywicy, ciemne owoce... Goryczka średnia, tytoniowo ziołowa. Wysycenie niskie, alkohol niewyczuwalny.
Bardzo solidny, mega czekoladowy, pięknie pachnący, pieknie wyglądający (pianę można jeść łyżeczką jak bitą śmietanę) i całkiem przyjemny w smaku Porter w amerykańskiej odsłonie (niestety Mikkeller nie podaje zastosowanych chmieli, ale obstawiam że są amerykańskie) :)

Chocolate and sulfur aroma. Pours black with huge and stable lacy foam. Taste is similar to nose with sulfur, chocolate and some coffee. Medium to low bitterness at the finish, full body. Overall I believe it used to be a great beer but not this time - sulfur is too distinct.

Pours black with a tall, solid and tanned head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla and roasted malt. Rich taste of coffee and vanilla, very bitter finish. Feels thick, flat and very savory. Wonderful and long after taste. Yummy beer.
Bottle from SlovakSniper. Thanks! Chocolate and licorice aroma. Dry roasty taste with licorice notes. Dark fruit and licorice in the finish. Tasty porter.

Dark brown colour. High beige head. Hints of berries, sour coffee beans, dark chocolate, bready notes in the aroma. Sour coffee beans, cocoa nibs dark chocolate at first. Sourness of the berries in the middle. Bread, dark chocolate in the end. Cocoa in the aftertaste. Rich palate. Very well balanced, very enjoyable porter.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color. Medium brown head. Taste is light to medium sweet and bitter. Body is medium and crisp. Aroma is chocolate, butty, hoppy, high roasted.

Butelka 0,33l Kolor czarny, piana świetna brązowa ,jak czapa z kożucha trzyma się mocno. Aromat to kawa i wiśnie w smaku mocna palonośc, łagodne,lekka kwasowośc ale nie przeszkadza, alkohol ukryty. Bardzo dobre piwo.
backlog. bottle. Aroma has hints of roast, spices, dark malts and chocolate. Complex and full on the tongue. Feels a lot bigger. Creamy finish. Good.

330 mL bottle from a trade with Slovak Sniper. Thanks Pat! Big and beautiful, this one is. Maybe the biggest (flavour) porter Ive tried. You dont get it from the nose, but you certainly do from the flavour. Booze, even. Its excellent.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 Piwo czarne jak smoła, z bujną, beżową pianą, która odmierza na szkle każdy łyk. W aromacie intensywna kawa, w tle jakieś czerwone owoce. W smaku do kawy dochodzi paloność i posmak gorzkiej czekolady, piwo jest też wyraźnie kwaskowe. Goryczka średnio wysoka.
From notes: Bottle at home bought from Firmabier. Pours black colour with medium head. Flavor is roasty, chocolaty, bitter and a bit fruity. Full/thick body. Complex and solid beer.

Taste is quite harmonious with light high chocolatey malty residual sugar and roasted + hoppy bitterness. Orange citrusy and lightly candyish sugary flavours. Quite good. 330 ml bottle from Gallaghers Beer World/El Irlandés. This is one of the darkest beers Ive seen. Pitch black pour with a small-medium light brown and creamy head that lingers. An intensely aromatic brew with a huge roasted and malty backbone that opens up some space for shiny hoppy touches. Notes of bitter chocolate, whole-grain dark bread, rye, toasted cereal grains, pecan nuts, peanuts, pistacchio, Pumpernickel bread, loads of Moccha, and some indistinguishable but very present "green", hoppy hints. Impressive and characterful. Taste starts somewhat sweet and bready but thats quickly replaced by really potent roastiness mid-way through, ending with strong (though not overwhelming) astringent bitterness and more massive roastiness. Flavors continue to unveil with warming, revealing high alpha-acids as well as more Moccha coffee-ish touches. Almost extreme on both sides (malt/hops) so, that means its quite well balanced. Incredibly intense throughout the whole experience!... Medium body but it feels thicker due to the amounts of flavor. Perfect medium carbonation. Alcohol warms up but its not noticeable in the taste nor aroma. Long roasty aftertaste. A challenging sipper, not an easy drinking one. Overall a fantastic hoppy Porter that overloads your tastebuds with flavor.

7.4%ABV. Porter.

Poured ouf of the bottle a very promising sludgy black producing a thin khaki brown head. A very enticing 40ºSRM. A color standard for all porters to aspire to, methinks.

The nose is full of light sweet flavors that reminiscent of cotton candy and leche espana. There are beautiful caramel, toffee, butterscotch and espresso like aromas.

The palate is ponderous with deeply roasted dark malt flavors in spades. Not like a traditional English porter because it is more agrressively carbonated as well as having a deeper, maltier, more black bread like experience. Porters are supposed to be heavier, but this is broader, deeper and more flavorful than a traditional porter, likely because traditional porters likely couldnt afford what it costs to brew this behemoth of an ale!

There is a nice clean carbon-sweet finish, like the burnt ends off a hunk of perfectly grilled char siew or bakkwa. So very familiarly inviting, and seductively engaging. 

Goes on Favorites List!

Mikkellers (robust) porter, one of their many beers made in Belgiums Proefbrouwerij (bur originally at Amager, I heard) and one of the true Mikkeller classics, I assume. Opaque jet black beer (but revealing it is actually an extremely dark ruby bronze in the last drops), under a thick and very stable, very regularly shaped, frothy, heavily and almost sabayon-like lacing, utterly dense and cappuccino-like, reddish beige head. Pleasant aroma of toasted bread, bitter chocolate, Cuban cigars, smoked bacon, subtle espresso, bayleaf, vanilla, home made caramel, fresh nettles, gooseberries, hazelnuts, cloves, grapefruit peel, Irish coffee, wood ashes, dried ginger, iron but in a natural kind of way, cream and dried plums. Taste begins quite intense, a condensed candied fruit sweetishness but subtly so, gentle sourish accent (lemon zest), soft carbonation, creamy, fatty mouthfeel, thick caramelly, nutty and chocolatey malts with amusing spicy notes dancing above, slight metallic tone but not disturbing, leading to a satisfying finish of roasted black coffee-like bitterness, peppery and leafy hop bitterness, some residual caramelly sweetishness and a subtly dosed portion of booze, in the form of warming, bourbon-like alcohol which does not become too intrusive at any point. Very well balanced, tasty, juicy black beer, creamy and flawless, but perhaps a bit too black and roasted to be a true porter - if you told me this is a stout, I would accept that just as easily.  Id probably identify it as an export stout or a dry stout in a blind tasting as well.

Bottle. Pours black with beige head. In aroma black malts, some rastiness, chocolate. In flavour little roastiness, chocolate, medium bitter finish. Nice one.

Amazing beer. Complex taste, of roasted malt, coffee and dark cacao. Has a pleasent crisp and the same boozy depth that barrel aged beers often have, although it hasnt been aged as far as I know. Very good.

Bottle, 8.0%. Quite roasted aroma, seems to have a little smoke, fruit and cream. Black colour, looks cloudy. Big stable brown head. The flavour is very roasted, nicely sweet and jammy with a good hoppy, piney and coffeeish.
Black, thick tan head. Aroma has licorice, coffee. Flavour has bitterness, something fruity, a little sweetness. Smooth feel, dry but semi sticky finish.

Thick creamy brownish head, coffee, rich, full bodied, with nice lacing, very creamy and rich in taste, well balanced, some sourish hints in the background, smooth, nicely done, seems more like an imperial porter than a regular one ....

Pours an opaque black into the glass, with a light tan head that leaves diminutive lacing. The nose is of ripened vinous notes, sweet fruit-infused breads (e.g. banana bread), some roasts, and finishing with a cherry note... with coffee infused on the latent finish.. The mouthfeel is semi-active with a round body and roasted-fruity palate. Very good porter from one of the greatest brewers alive.

Bottle sample at a tasting a at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Stas. Black with a light brown head. Roasty aroma with light fruitiness. Roasty flavor, a bit acidic, with light sweetness, coffee and a burnt finish. Rounded mouthfeel.
Bottle at home. Black with a dark brown head. Aroma medium+ malty (roasted, chocolate, coffee). Flavor medium sweet and bitter. Medium+ body, soft carboated.

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn ( 4,30), July 2014. Love the styling. Pours pitch black, brown around the edges, with a massive dark creamy head. Nose is an intoxicating display of heavy roastiness, chocolate and cocoa, spices, something burnt, and hops; its also got some sweet vinous aspects reminiscent of Barley Wine or Strong Ale. Excellent porter. Malty, ashy aroma of coffee, chocolate. Taste is roasted malt with vanilla, hops, chocolate, cofee. Bitersweet smoky finnish.
330 ml bottle @ home. Pours jet black with a frothy head that fades quickly. Nose has licorice, ash and coffee. Taste has chocolate, coffee and some red berry notes as it warms up. Well made!
Porter superlativa! Molto gustosa e caratterizzata, riempie la bocca e il naso con intense note caffettose, di cioccolato, liquerizia e una punta amarotica. Ottima!

Bottle. Pours very dark brown with a lasting and lacing creamy light brown moderate head. Aroma is sweet and malty with raisin, cocoa powder, dark sugars, roasted malt, sweet coffee, plenty of chocolate and hops, mild vanilla, licorice and a hint of smoke. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft+. Finishes balanced, roasted and bittersweet. I like it.

Bottle at home. High creamy and good looking brown lasting head. Pitch black body. Smooth and pleasant roasted malt coffee liquorice aroma. Flavor dominated by sweet liquorice rather than coffee. A solid roasted malt base in combination with a fair amount of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long finish. Alcohol well hidden.
shared bottle with a friend. poured dark brown to black with a nice big tan head. roasted malts, big bitter chocolate, caramel, coffee, nice bitterness, full mouthfeel. lovely brew

Divano Cellars bottle (13-Jun-2014) Sweet choc coffee roast malt aroma.Black colour, low brown head&sheet lace.Big sweet roast choc coffee liquorice flavour.Bitter choc coffee roast malt finish&sweet roast choc aftertaste.
Herbal fruit malt aroma. Dark brown colour fair head and lacing. Malt cherry malt chocolate flavour. Smooth palate.

zwart ondoorzichtig met bruine kraag. aroma van geroosterde- en gebrande mouten, naast de koffie en chocolade en iets van laurier. 
smaken zijn iets van turf/veen, redelijk zoet, vrij licht bitter, sterke smaken, matige donkere fruiten, sterke geroosterde en gebrande mouten. verder een volle body, romig in de mond en lage co2, met een ietwat kruidige en zoetige afdronk.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016 A 8 % ABV version. Pours pitch black with steady two-finger constant head, which leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. Beautiful beer. Aroma has intense licorice notes with burnt wood and hints of milk chocolate and earthiness. Taste is again very licorice-like, with woodiness and dark chocolate. Hints of burnt notes are also present. Some milkiness is somewhere there also. Palate is very intense and little attacking, some bitterness is also present. All in all, very intense porter, almost too intense and the drinkability suffers a bit. Its also too attacking for sipping.

Bottle at Taps, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is light grass hop and some malt. The flavour is strong bitter with a huge, totally dominating, grassy nettle hop palate and a long bitter finish. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. I think the grass bucket of my lawnmower curled up and died in this brew. Seriously over-hopped for me. Its half way toward a black IPA, but not in a nice way. I read some of the other ratings and its like Im rating a different beer but Im not. Cant see a Best Before date on the bottle :-(

0,33l fles gedeeld met bryanvdv, zwart met een mooie volle diepbruine kleur. Mooi aroma gebrande mouten zijn mooi in balans met koffie en chocolade tonen. Smaak is ook erg aangenaam met kersen tonen en rozijnen in de afdronk donkere chocolade. Zeer aangename porter

Fles gedeeld met rikstar. Zeer donker bier met bruine kraag. Aroma van koffie, chocolade, gebrande mouten. Smaak is zoet met bittere afdronk. Er zit ook een klein zuurtje in. Body is mooi in balans.

Almost a little too harsh up front for not a much depth.mat the end. This has a great chocolate, coffee taste but is out done by an unwanted bitterness. Pours black with a light foam. Over a little too bitter for me in the style of Mikkeller .

Bottle. Black with a large dark brown creamy head. Good retention and lace. Roasted malt, chocolate, chalk, charcoal, ink, light green hops. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Medium bitter finish with roasted malt and smoke. A bit thin in the finish and a bit pungent.

Pours black with a fine, creamy even beige head. Smells of roasted malts, coffee, burnt sugar. Strong flavor of coffee and chocolate, dark malt, light red fruits, nice initial sweetness. Light final acidity, thick mouthfeel. Very good, long lasting bitter aftertaste with some hops. Excellent.

Pours a dark black beer with a lot of dark stable beige foam. 
Smells burnt and roasted, chocolaty and some milkinesses, Strong malt smell with a hint of some spices.
 Taste: burnt malts, a hint of sweetness and a lot of malt bitter.
leaves a long lingering bitterness in the palate. 
Great beer but if I would taste this blind I would think I be drinking a real good stout.
Zwart met donker schuim.. Zwaar, qua geur en smaak. Beetje te, maar waarschijnlijk wel lekker iets eerder pp de avond.
Zwarte kleur met een volle bruine kraag. Ruikt koffie, vanille. Smaakt koffie, vanille bittere afdronk.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle, says 8% abv, poured into a snifter. Pours opaque black with medium light brown head. Aroma is rich roast, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is roasty, herbal hops, chocolate, and bitter finish.  One of the best regular porters I have had.

330 ml bottle from BG Birra, served in a nonic pint glass. Pitch black, absolutely no light passing through, with a nice, creamy and persistent dark brown head. Great lacing. On the nose roasted malts, a hint of ash/smoke, some meaty qualities, slightly spicy (vanilla, licorice) and a good amount of espresso coffee and dark bitter chocolate. Again meaty upfront, light acidity which help to clean the palate after every sip, not overly roasted or bitter, soild amount of milky chocolate sweetness. The alchool is well hidden. Slightly smoky and coffee forward aftertaste. Average carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Great porter.

very dense and stable beige mocha head that disappears very slowly and with structured lacing (never seen anything like this before). coffee coloured. aroma is coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, leather, bit yeasty, taste like aroma with a solid bitterness. medium body and carbonation. yummy.
I think I have had this bottle in my beer fridge for 3 years or more. Its still damn good. Lots of nice chocolate notes, well integrated roasted malt, slight bitterness...really tasty.

330ml bottle from rehills newcastle. pours a very very dark brown with dark, solid brown head. aroma is of coffee, roasted malts and bitter chocolate. excellent taste. lots of coffee, really smooth and very drinkable. after taste lasts a long time. bitter but not too bitter. really nice.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This inky back beer pours with a bright brown foamy head. It has citrus fruit, liquorice, chocolate and coffee flavours with a creamy red fruit and leather finish. Fantastic!

ABV 8.0%. A pitch black beer with the great head that is big, creamy and yellowish brown. The nose is strongly roasted, coffee, some sweetness and salt liquirice, also fruits and piney bitterness. The great aroma that is temptating to taste. Taste is roasted, but not dry, coffee, lots of piney hops to refreshning taste. Medium+ bodied, medium carbonation, enoughly smooth to drink. The great beer that is quite similar than Plevnan Siperia.

Bottle shared by Abijen @ weekly tasting. Opaque pitch black color, full sized lightly creamy light brown head. Aroma has roasted malts, lightly a touch of hops, liquorice. Taste malts, roasted malts, a touch of peat, bitter, liquorice. Medium body and carbonation. Nice one!
Pours a pitch black beer with a good tan head. Smells chocolate, coffee and roasted. Tastes chocolate, peated, roasted with a good bitter finish. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Bottle @ joes shared by Abijen. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head. Smells liquorice, roasty, chocolate, some coffee. Tastes oak, some whisky, coffee, very roasty, coal. Medium to full body with soft carbo. Nice beer!

Bottle, 4/8/14. Pours dark brown with creamy tan head, settles quickly with minimal lace. Aroma is sweet, toffee, caramel, nutty malt, caramelized sugars. Flavor is big toffee, nutty malt, fairly sweet with a mellow, nutty, toasted, and mildly bitter finish. More caramelized and toasted than dark and roasted. Soft carbonation, medium body, and smooth texture.

07.04.2014, 0,5l bottle @ BBGTC tasting:
Small bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, dark malts, dark sugar, roasted grain, coffee, licorice, chocolate, grass. Taste is slightly sweet, dark malts, sugar, roasted grain, hay, licorice, caramel, chocolate. Medium bitterness, slightly watery mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a pitch black body with a small caramel head. Nose is coffee, dark chocolate, leather, sour-ish licorice tones, hints of grains and alcohol. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, grains, hints of licorice and port wine. Medium body and carbonation. Fair enough, but nothing out of the ordinary.

Bottle , looks very the same as this picture , but the chair is red, so are the tittles and they switched places ( porter above, mikkeller below ) . 8 ABV on the bottle.
Pours black, dark brown head
Smell is intense, typical porter characters are there , plus a nice amount of chocolate .

Very balanced and nice !

Aroma is quite boozy with some sweet vanilla and earthy tones. Very thick texture. Flavour is very strong. Bitter with burnt roasted malts and sweet with some vanilla and fruits. Peaty, earthy flavours are a bit overpowering.

Pitch black medium body with a finger of creamy brown foam. Fills the nose with mocha. Hints of coffee, alcohol and oats are there too. Same taste, leaves the feeling of cocoa in the mouth with a bitter mocha aftertaste.
Pours jet black with huge lacing. Aroma is a little coffee, roasted malts, some dried fruits, a small amount of hops. Simply amazing porter!

Now this is one porter to be an example. Black it pours with dark brown, thick top. Not so malt sweetness oriented as stouts, but still has malt bill in front of all other aspects, seems hopped also richfuly cause overall bitterness is high. What I liked that it was more than medium bodied, thick-full mouthfeel, average dry finish. Very decent.

Barwa: czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana brązowa, obfita, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, utrzymująca się. Wysycenie średnie.

Aromat: kawa, czekolada, palone słody, lekka nuta owocowa. 

Smak: wytrawny, kawowy, z wyraźna goryczką pochodzącą z ciemnych słodów oraz lekką kwaskowością. Alkoholowy koniec.

Lubię portery za ich kawowo czekoladowe akcenty, niestety mam wrażenie, że ostatnio zanikają one na rzecz stoutów (zwłaszcza imperialnych), które stały się bardzo modne. Mimo tego polecam.
Pours black with beige head. Roast, alcohol, and dried fruit on the nose. Bitter chocolate, maybe some molasses and faint coffee flavours. Roasty astringency and alcohol hit you on the finish.

Simple yet impressive brew. Quite intense roasted malts, cute caramel and interesting breadiness, bit smoke makes this one special. Some vanilla, some licorice in background
Nice balance. Nothing extraordinary, but interesting and enjoyable brew

330ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner großen bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv röstmalzig, Kaffeebohnen. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig, bittere Schokolade, schwarzer Kaffee, minimal fruchtig salziger Abgang.

Bottle from AmmersinO, Vienna. Dark brown to black body, with a beautiful, big, creamy, tan head, that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, wood, earth, liquorice, dark fruits, some alcohol. Mouthfeel is full, creamy, with a medium carbonation and it finishes complex, with bitter, roasty and sweet notes of chocolate, coffee, smoke and a slight fruityness. The wooden smoke notes pleasantly stay very long in the back of the throat. Overall simply delicious, one of the very best Porters Ive had so far! Perfectly balanced, elegant, with wonderful, complex, dark aromas and a very nice, smooth smokiness.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a large, frothy and bubbly tan head, long retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee and roast malt with earthy and herbal hops, figs, dates, and prunes. Flavor is malt dominant with dark fruity esters, light hops and medium bitterness with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation

Bottle. Pours black with very nice beige head. Aroma: roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, a bit of fruits and smoky. Taste: dark chocolate, a bit of coffee, nice bitter and smoky finish. Its full body and oily. Very good beer.

Black color with huge light - brown head, nicely lacing glass. Aroma: dark chocolate, roasted malts, cherries, licorice, coffee, hops, red wine - I like it. Taste: dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, smoky, some hops in background. Nice bitter and sweet, a bit smoky finish. Full body with medium carbonation and creamy, smooth texture.
Really great porter.

33cl bottle from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - opaque black with a generous crema head.
Nose - dark chocolate with some boozy fruit. Creamy background. 
Taste - more dark chocolate with black cherries in booze. Black Forest Gateau. 
Palate - rich im body and texture with just enough freshness on the finish. 
Overall - great example of the Porter style.

Black with a light tan head. Aroma is chocolate and red wine. Flavor is rich chocolate with a strong bitter finish which perfectly balances the sweetness. Coats the tongue nicely like a mocha.

Wife: 4.75

Color negro con reflejos rojizos y una espuma beige oscuro y muy densa. Aromas de café, galleta y torrefactos. En boca es densa con un inicio dulces y tostado que pasa a un amargor seco y acafetado que se va haciendo cada vez más resinoso en el regusto. Muy rica.

Aroma - is noticeably chocolate, roast, caramelized sugars, and some alcohol
Appearance - very dark brown body, which is opaque, the tan head about 1/2" falls to a thin ring
Taste - the taste is more sweet than roast bitters; chocolate, roast and caramelized sugar dominate
Palate - the body is full, the texture more slick, carbonation appropriate somewhat soft, the finish is velvety with the roast astringency settling on the side of the tongue.

Very much enjoy this brewery

500ml bottle in a tulip. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, a little smokiness, some dough, and light bitterness. Flavor the same with a great blend of all of the dark malts. Smooth to thicker texture. A really good porter.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 0,33L bottle, BB 24.09.17. Pours pitch black with huge brown head. The head stays. Aroma is bitter, coffee, toast, smoke. Taste follows the nose, feels a lot like rauchbier-porter. Finish is nice and bitter. Overall: i would say its more "smoked" than porter, at least it reminds me more "Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen" than "Fullers London Porter" (both excellent examples of their styles). Still whatever the style is, this is just a great beer.

Cerveza porter, capa de espuma muy ligera, cremosa y pegajosa color beige. Olor principalmente a café y malta tostada. En boca se aprecian las maltas tostadas y achocolatadas, pronunciándose las últimas sobre todo y dando paso a un sabor ligeramente lupulado, dejando un final bastante dulce.

Bottle. Pours an almost pitch black body, with a brown head that diminishes slowly, leaving a very good lace. Mostly coffee aroma, along with a bittersweet taste, with coffee and chocolate being present. Oily and smooth texture, medium to full body, very nice carbo level. That was really nice, would have been world class if it were a little sweeter.
Rich slightly smokey malty aroma. Taste a touch of the licorice and burnt euralt but is much more pleasant in this one Maybe its a touch of sweetness and coffee
Pours black with tan head. Nose is roasty malt. Taste us coffee chocolate and roasted nuts.
Pitch black, with a dense tan head. Bittersweet chocolate, espresso, molasses, finishing off dry. No hint of 8% abv. Really nice stuff.

Bottle from Thistle News. It pours jet black with a massive tan head. The nose is roasted malt, earth, smoke, charred wood, toast, citrus peel and dark fruit. The taste is rich roast, toast, earth, treacle, dark chocolate, coffee, decent bitterness and mild acidity. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Rich, punchy and rather tasty.

Bottle from Bierkompaas!

Pours deep black with brownish creamy head. Smell has very strong coffee notes and lots of bitter roasted malts. Starts with massive coffee notes, chocolate and roasted malts, overall surprisingly sweet. Middle past has delicious sweet chocolate notes, paired with coffee, nuts, roasted malts and some slight yeast notes. Finish is chocolatey with strong roasted coffe notes, slight yeasty. Outstanding Porter!!!

All you can expect from a strong porter is condensed in this one. Dominated by the eminently coffee-ish aroma, the taste is enriched with some sweet notes to liquor and mature black fruits. The alcohol is perfectly integrated, making the overall perfectly balanced, rich and deep. Great porter.
Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark chocolate, & coffee; Flavor of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, and some hops; Finish has quite a bit of roast; Nice.

Bottle at good attitude beer shop
Really good beer
Very tastefull and well balanced. Roasted malts, licorice

15/XII/13 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 24/IX/17 (2013-1152) 
Very dark brown to black beer, huge beige irregular head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: mocha, toast, rye bread, grains, bit of caramel. Botella 33 cl. Cuerpo medio y espuma oscura. Rico aroma a chocolate y sabor a café y chocolate amargo, con ligero picante. Me ha encantado. Very nice beer !!!.
Bottle. Very dark body, dark creamy head. Aroma of espresso coffee and some smoked one. Taste was bitter smoky, oily, chocolate and some hops. Bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle, best before 24/09/17. Pours a very dark brown/black with a coffee coloured head. Aroma is slightly medicinal with bitter coffee and choc. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Slightly lighter in body than I suspected it would be based on appearance. Nice level of coffee, not too bitter, with dark choc and a hint of citrus in the finish. Tasty.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014 
Look: dark brown/black chocolate. A thumb high, very solid and consistent foam, brown/caramel color. Low carbonation; good lacing. 


Smell: huge roasty, smokey, coffee malt notes. Hint of fresh hop fragrance, a fruity character. Subtle but charming.


Taste: big dark roasted, smokey malt middle then comes a hint of freshness from hops. Theres a nice balance of roasted malt and hop flavour. This especially comes to life in the nice bitter coffee/hops aftertaste. The roasted character is not overblown. There are some hints of tart. 


Mouthfeel: Very smooth/creamy, medium body. Alcohol well hidden. A nice coating, easy sipper.


Overall: Good representative of a american porter, the hop character with roasted malt make a nice balance, will pick it up again.

33cl bottle. It is written on that bottle that it is brewed and bottled at De Proef Brouwerij in Belgium.  Pitch black with light brown, thick head. 
NOSE : black chocolate, strong lactic aromas, cocoa, cheese, caramel, vanilla, nuts, dried raisins.
SIP : medium thick and oily with delicate carbonation. Sweet and creamy with strong cocoa and black chocolate like flavors. It has a delicate booze feeling to it too. While it keeps the sweet layer it becomes a bit dry like coffee. Bitterness is moderate and it is mostly burned chalk like. Finish is dry and bitter with earthy feeling on tongue. Almost like an ashtray but not putting off. Notes of banana and red grapes reveal themselves after couple of sips. Maybe even apples. 
OVERALL : a very nice and complex aroma comes with a smooth body and rich flavor. Complex and balanced enough to live up its reputation. Delicious.

Botella de 50 cl. De tranqui en en casa una tarde de primavera de 2013. De color negro intenso y poca espuma color marfil. Cuerpo ligero y poco cremoso con regusto amargo verde y tostado de café . Ligera porter con finos sabores tostados y amargos verdes muy bien combinados. Numerosos posos en fondo de botella que al echarlos en el vaso potencian algo el sabor tostado haciéndola un poco mas cremosa. Recomendable no muy fria para potenciar un poco mas el sabor. Bastante lejos de esas grandes porter de la gama alta y mas aun de las envejecidas en barriles con los que nos sorprende Mikkeller. Una porter basica en el mundo Mikkeller
UPDATED: NOV 4, 2013 Really good. Aroma is coffee and caramel. Flavor is same as aroma. So great you may light yourself on fire and not notice.

Half liter bottle from Woodmans in Waukesha, cellar aged a while (2 months?). Pours a very dark brown with a light brown head leaving some spots of lace. Black pour, moderate sized tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma is dominated by chocolate but has notes of roast, caramel, licorice, a light hop presence. Medium to full bodied, smooth, chocolate flavor with light licorice notes.

Pine coffee aroma. Sweetness in there too. Dark appearance with wispy yellowish head. Low carbonation. Creamy texture. Bitter aftertaste but there is a sweetness in the malts. Woody pine dark chocolate with liquorice flavours. Well balanced. Very nice.

Light auburn head with a full bodied flavor. Perfect beer for dark crafted fans. I was pleasantly surprised by this porter and its slightly chocolately taste. Dont expect to see any light seep through your glass.

On tap at 2d2dspuma. Black colour with beige head. Chocolate and coffee aroma. Chocolate taste, slightly sweet, some roastness. Medium to full body.

Aroma of dark chocolate and some coffee. Strong chocolate flavour with burnt coffee. A little to burnt and a little to one dimensional in the flavour for my taste. Slightly to bitter too.

A nice balanced strong porter.
Bottle at Brewdog Edinburgh. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with coffee, liquorice, nuts, roasted malts and hops. Bitter finish with liquorice and roasted malts. Exquisite strong porter.
Jet black pour with a thick tan cap.  Roasted malt, lots of espresso, smoky peat, leather, booze and cocoa.  Delicious

Black color with 2 fingers beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, some bitter chocolate, coffee, hazelnuts, earthy hops. Taste is light sweet, just a bit sour and nice bitterness at the end. Chocolate and smoke flavor. Medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation. Really good, barrel aging will make it amazing I think.

Deep, dark brown, rich mocha tan head. Leather, coffee, chocolate, smoke and a touch of hop bitterness in the aroma. So rich in flavour, more sweet chocolate up front, a blast of coffee, then a rousing hop bite. Smooth, slick mouthfeel, carbonation is almost flat, not quite. Lush chocolate finish. An almost perfect porter.

0,5 bottle from Berlin Bier shop. Dark brown with off white head. Aroma is malty and toffeish. Sweet and caramelly taste with toastyness and licourice. A nice Malty finish. Nothing out of the ordenary but a well crafted porter id like to taste many times again.

Bottle @ BBQ13: Served in a taster:
Medium sized quickly changing light brown colored foamy head on top of a black colored beer.
Aromas of roast, liquorice (wood), molasses, roasted barley malts and espresso.
Flavours of liquorice wood, roast, bitter, liquorice, chocolate, roasted barley malts, coffee and chocolate.
Aftertate is liquorice, bitter and roast.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, medium to full body and a creamy thicker texture. Another well executed beer from Mikkeller. Yummi!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from Reston Wine Cabinet. Pours black with an inch of khaki foam. A bit of roasted on the nose. A bit thin on the tongue. Flavor fades as it warms. Solid but not spectacular.
dark chocolate pour, foamy frothy head. "a Handsome beer". aroma of roasted nuts, chocolate. roasted malts, chocolate in flavor. Fuller body. dry finish. Like not love

bottle from Aurora Brew Works, East Aurora, NY. Dark pour, white head. Creamy body & mouthfeel. Chocolate, roasted malts, touch of coffee in aroma. Flavorful, chocolatey, mild to medium roast. Fuller mouthfeel. Nice Porter

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with small tan head. Dark aroma of malt, caramel and dried fruit. Roasty, malty flavour with notes of caramel and coffee beans. Very well balanced. Dryish aftertaste. Needs to be re-rated as the bottle had been open for 24 hours. Still, very good.

500ml bottle from Sams, Durham. One of the better examples of the style Ive had in years, and a nice bargain to boot. Nice soupy dark brown pour, with a thick silken head, tons of lacing, and an overall appealingly substantive look. Rich and chocolatey as fuck, with dry notes everywhere for balance. Really a superlative example of the style, elegant and never too boozy.

Pours an opaque very dark brown with a brown head that quickly amounts to a soapy long lasting ring around the glass and leaves great lace. Aroma is rich sweet maltiness, licorice, toast, dried plums, raisins, toffee and mild alcohol. Flavour is roasted malts just short of being burnt, medium bitterness, dark malt dryness, rich sweet malt, toffee, dried fruits and alcohol.

Pours an opaque black with a big frothy brown head. Aroma of chocolate, sweet dried fruits like prunes and dates, cocoa and nice floral hop notes. Taste is sweet dried fruits, chocolate, bitter cocoa, slight roasted malts and a nice smooth bitterness on the finish. Finishes slightly dry but has a really good balance of sweet malts, bitterness and alcohol warmth. Would definitely drink this again and again.

Bottle from Brewdog. Pours almost pitch black with a big, fast collapsing tanned head. Aroma of chocolate and roasted coffee. Smooth silky mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet chocolate, moderate burnt coffee to balance it off. Lingering bitter chocolate mixed with burnt coffee, even some smoked notes in the back.

Rich dark brown with tan head and nice pointillist lacing. Nice rounded choco malt aroma, bit of booze. Gorgeous on the palate, bit of carbonation sizzling the rich and earthy taste onto the tongue. Top drawer porter, slightly heavy on the boozy finish.

(500ml bottle) very dark brown, lasting dark tan head. Nose is so rich, cream, graham cracker, milk chocolate, complex and awesome. Taste of milk chocolate, chocolate malt, rich and creamy, smooth, cocoa nibs, not bitter at all just rich and delicious.

Black pour with a thin, frothy off white head. Big chocolatey aroma with notes of sweet fruit, heavy roast, light coffee, touch of vanilla and some booze. Flavors were roasty, lots of chocolate, hint of licorice and sweet fruits. Velvety mouthfeel. Top notch, one of if not the best in its style.

Dark black with mocha bubbly head and nice lacing. Aroma of bubblegum, roasted malts, chocolate, the dirt surrounding strawberry patches. Taste is quite roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, but with a nice fruity milk chocolate element as well. Awesome porter.
March 2012. From bottle. Pours black with a creamy tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate and licorice. smooth finish.

Bottle. Pours dark brown black with a large foamy sudsy khaki head that slowly settles to a foamy film and subtle lacing. Aroma has bitterness and yeast with malt all around. Taste is roasted malt little coffee flavor and chocolate as well with a nice bitterness of hops that are piny and a little fruity with hidden peat/smoke in the background. Palate is medium and chalky with a dry finish.
Aroma of butter and chocolate, black colour with a tanned head. Lovely full mouth feel, little warming from the alcohol, taste of roasted malts and coffee. Really good

I dig this beer. So interesting for a porter, although I suppose I should expect nothing less from Mikkeller. Pours black with off white head. Strong aromas of chocolate, cream soda, and vanilla. Strawberries too. Sweet fruity flavours, more of that cream soda taste, with a roasted malt finish. Unique, and delicious.

500ml bottle courtesy of JohnRMurdoch - very dark brown near black, thin tan head, lovely aroma of chocolate and vanilla, no lacing, flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol, viscous and oily texture
500ml bottle from Hippo Beers. Almost black, not much head. Coffee chocolate & vanilla aroma & flavour. Smooth & velvety texture. A well balanced porter.
The empediment of a porter. A creamy roasted flavor with both sweetness and bitterness. Very dark brown with a light brown head.
